chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Operating While Revoked (Cause Great Bodily Harm)
Knowingly Operating While Revoked (Cause Great Bodily Harm)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawn M Loomis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Reckless Driving-Cause Bodily Harm, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.62(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If the stayed portion of the sentence is imposed and there are outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall provide current financial information to the court.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.
If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Per C-31.
$500.00 cash bond to be applied to Restitution.
Court orders that minimum monthly payments of $365.00 be made through Probation Agent with the first payment due on 09/05/2014 and on the 5th of each month thereafter until it is paid in full.
Restitution in the amount of $106,876.89 is to be converted to Judgment in favor of Virtual Health Management.  This Judgment is stayed 30 days.  Attorney Harrington allowed 30 days from today's date to request a hearing on restitution regarding Virtual Health Management.

AMENDED 11/18/14: AMENDED RESTITUTION ORDER FILED IN THE SUM OF $125,108.44.
COURT ORDERS THE DISTRICT ATTORNEY'S OFFICE TO VERIFY WITH THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS THAT RESTITUTION PAYMENTS ARE BEING DISPERSED TO THE VICTIM IN FULL PRIOR TO ANY PAYMENTS BEING MADE TO VIRTUAL HEALTH MANAGEMENT OR ANY OTHER ORGANIZATION.
COURT ORDERS DEFENDANT TO PAY $365.00 PER MONTH TOWARDS RESTITUTION.
Must obtain and maintain full-time employment.
Must not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.

timeConds.notes:
Must report to jail by 1:00 PM today, August 15, 2014.
Court grants work release.

Defendant Shawn M Loomis in court with attorney Andrew Joseph Harrington.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
THIS COVERS 14CF27 and 14CT20
State relates and requests the amount to the insurance company to be added to the C-31. Attorney Harrington relates. 

10:10 Richard Jasperson with Richard L Jasperson PA,  called, sworn and direct by State.  
Exhibit 1: Subrogation Claim Summary. Marked for State. Offered and received. 
$116405.48 due as of 11/14/14 based upon Virtual Health Management. 
10:30 Redirect by State. 
10:31 Shawn M Loomis called, sworn and direct by Defense. 
Exhibit 2: Defendant's Financials. Marked for Defense. Offered and received. 
10:38 Cross by State. 
10:41 Court questions. 
Exhibit 3: Subrogation Claim Summary with Line Items. Marked for State. Defense objects. Court relates. Defense will proceed. State offers the exhibit. Defense objects. Court receives the exhibit. 
10:47 Richard Jasperson recalled, and direct by State. 
10:52 Cross by Defense
10:53 Court questions. 
10:55 Testimony Closed. 
Argument by State. Argument by Defense. Rebuttal by State.

Court relates and finds: 
The Defendant does have the ability to pay. 
The amount of the Restitution Order to the victim previously filed stands. 
Court finds that Virtual Health Management is not an insurance company and finds there is credible evidence that there were not any duplicate payments. 

Court orders that the District Attorney's Office file an Amended Information to include the $116405.48 owed to Virtual Health Management. The C-31 should have specific indication that the victim is to be paid in full prior to any payments to Virtual Health Management or any other organization. 
Court orders the District Attorney's Office to verify with the Department of Corrections that Restitution payments are being dispersed to the victim in full prior to any payments being made to Virtual Health Management or any other organization. 
Court orders the Defendant pay $365.00 a month towards Restitution. 

If financial circumstances change, Defendant has the right to petition the court for review.
